The given Node.js code dynamically exports either a production or development version of the "immer" library based on the environment configuration. The code checks the value of the `NODE_ENV` environment variable. If `NODE_ENV` is set to 'production', it exports the minified production version of the "immer" library. Otherwise, it exports the development version. This approach helps in optimizing the application by using minimized code in production and more verbose, possibly debug-friendly code, in the development environment.

```javascript
'use strict';

const productionModule = './immer.cjs.production.min.js';
const developmentModule = './immer.cjs.development.js';

const isProduction = process.env.NODE_ENV === 'production';
const modulePath = isProduction ? productionModule : developmentModule;

module.exports = require(modulePath);
```
